You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017
Optimizing network monitoring and event management...

Architecting and developing IT performance services for Fortune 100 companies. Brought on to develop new professional services that aligned with overall corporate goals, working with team of six consultants. Analyzed customers’ websites and how they are supporting business initiatives, developed recommendations to enable them to meet goals. Managed complex projects utilizing consultants and collaborative resources. Generated $1+ million annual revenue pipeline with development of focused professional consulting services. Leveraged all Compuware Dynatrace products to deliver high value projects.

•  Created the performance and capacity management services for all IT network, server, and storage platforms•  Grew the team from one (1) to more than fifteen (15) to encompass Enterprise Systems Management (monitoring systems)•  Lead the evaluation, selection, and implementation of the application, performance, and fault management systems to help the organization proactively address capacity and performance concerns and improve incident response•  Supervised the evaluation, procurement, and implementation of SAS statistical software for complex capacity studies•  Applying data management, mining, and analytics to correlate end-user experience and system metrics to isolate the root cause of performance degradation•  Leveraged CA eHealth and SPECTRUM, OPNET ACE, ACELive, EMS and Panorama, ZOHO Manage Engine, Compuware Gomez, SAS JMP, Enterprise Guide, and Data Miner, Arbor Peakflow SP, Zabbix, Web Page Test, Show Slow, Mondrian, and Kettle

Helping IT organizations improve the end-user experience by optimizing application and network performance.•  Worked with Account Managers across North America selling OPNET Consulting services to Enterprise clients; responsible for $12M annual quota•  Developed and delivered all sales and services presentations; authored Applications Network Readiness (ANR) whitepaper; presented ANR methodology to regional user groups; conducted two web-based technical workshops on Performance Engineering

Transforming capacity planning and developing performance engineering services.•  Lead the transformation of capacity reporting, management systems, and network engineering teams into a full-service performance engineering organization while developing new application and network readiness methods and services•  Managed six different design & engineering teams and one project management team for Technology Infrastructure Services division; accountable for team strategies, internal marketing, budget, workflow, performance, training and career development•  Increased the number of teams managed from two to five, personnel from ten (10) to twenty (20), and financial responsibility from $100,000 to over $2M in less than two years•  Leveraged HP OpenView Network Node Manager (NNM), OPNET ACE, and SAS IT Resource Manager ( ITRM)

EVBSC was modeled after The National Charity League. Since the NCL is a mother/daughter organization, EVBSC gives boys and both parents the opportunity to volunteer for many different kinds of service. I volunteered to be the liaison to the Salvation Army. My responsibility is to work with local SA offices and communicate to the group the various charity events available. In addition, we volunteer for other events, such as the Tempe Halloween Festival

Charles Schwab created a program called 'Money Matters' to teach the fundamentals of money and finance to children and teens. In a partnership with the Boys and Girls Clubs around the country, Schwab employees could volunteer to teach the eight week course. This type of course should be part of everyone's education, starting in grade school. Such an important and often misunderstood life skill is critical for anyone.

summary: The topic of information technology is a broad one, spanning from help desk support to the Chief Information Officer, and each component plays a part in the company’s success. Throughout my career, I have gained a wealth of experience and knowledge across the board, working with industries of various sizes and disciplines to help them reach their objectives. While IT is where I hang my hat, my true passion lies in the bigger topic of business development and strategy. By reviewing and analyzing a company’s data as it relates to their network architecture, engineering, and operations, I can develop a plan that works. In addition to the expected business components, people are naturally a huge benefit to an organization’s success. I build teams of focused individuals who share the company’s mission and values and seamlessly support the systems and strategies we've put in place, leading to increased results.My focus on human capital does not stop with our internal teams; I develop strong relationships with clients as their advocate to ensure that they too achieve their goals. It’s a bit of a domino effect: create strong relationships internally with employees who love their jobs and then that just naturally flows through to our work with clients. Contact me to learn more about my experience and passion. I look forward to starting our conversation.
name: Brian Curcio
title: Technical Director, Monitoring at Charles Schwab
